description: This file is a startup shell script for setting up and managing a local MySQL database server, applying migrations, seeding data, and launching a database visualizer interface. It includes helper functions for waiting on TCP ports, executing SQL files, applying migrations and seeds, and managing the MySQL server lifecycle.

methods.name: wait_for_tcp
methods.description: Waits for a TCP port on a given host to become open with retries and delays.

methods.name: run_sql_file
methods.description: Executes an SQL file against the database, trying different connection methods.

methods.name: apply_migrations
methods.description: Applies SQL migration files in order if not already applied.

methods.name: apply_seed
methods.description: Applies seed data if not already present.
